intro: Gaultheria congesta, commonly known as the clustered wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, commonly known as the heath or cranberry family. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are evergreen, glossy, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Gaultheria congesta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
